conclusion: Shadows are created by objects blocking light, and their direction and length are determined by the angle and position of the light source.

premise: When the light source moves forward, the light rays approach the objects from a more direct angle.
conclusion: The direction and length of the shadows will change.
The initial scene shows four objects above the slabs: a cake, a yellow folder, a blue juice box, and a baseball.
The shadows A, B, C, and D are cast on the ground in front of the objects.

premise: The light source moves forward above the objects.
conclusion: The shadows A, B, C, and D will shift backward, away from the objects.

premise: The light source moves closer in the horizontal plane, increasing the angle between the light rays and the horizontal line.
conclusion: The shadows A, B, C, and D will become shorter.

premise: The shadows A, B, C, and D shift backward and become shorter due to the change in the angle and position of the light source.
conclusion: The shadows A, B, C, and D will move backward and become shorter and smaller.
